employees) (/page/adjusting-after-job-loss) Sponsor work opportunities for job seekers (Job creation partnerships) (/page/ontario-job-creation-partnerships) Get funding to address challenges to hiring, training and retaining workers (/page/skills-development-fund) Get help from a counsellor Workers and job seekers can make a free appointment to speak with an employment counsellor to help you develop career goals, prepare for interviews or start a job. Speak with an employment counsellor in: Northern Ontario and City of Toronto (https://www.eoss.tcu.gov.on.ca/CitizenPortal/infoAboutYou.do?programCode=ESI&lang=en) regions any other region (https://www.eoss.tcu.gov.on.ca/CitizenPortal/infoAboutYou.do?programCode=EAP&lang=en) Employers can make a free appointment to speak with an employment counsellor to get advice about attracting and recruiting the right employees and find financial incentives to offset on-the-job training costs. You can also get advice about managing your workforce during restructuring. Speak with an employment counsellor in: Northern Ontario and City of Toronto (https://www.eoss.tcu.gov.on.ca/CitizenPortal/infoAboutYou.do?programCode=ESE&lang=en) regions any other region (https://www.eoss.tcu.gov.on.ca/CitizenPortal/infoAboutYou.do?programCode=EAP&lang=en) Other government services Employment Insurance benefits for workers who have lost their job (https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/ei.html) Ontario Student Assistance Program ( (/page/osap-ontario-student-assistance-program) OSAP) helps you pay for post-secondary school (/page/osap-ontario-student-assistance-program) Ontario Works: Support for those not qualifying for Employment Insurance (/page/ontario-works) Ontario Disability Support Program ( (/page/ontario-disability-support-program) ODSP ): Support for people with disabilities (/page/ontario-disability-support-program) Moving from another province to Ontario for work (http://www.workersmobility.ca/workers/) Moving to Ontario from outside Canada (/page/work-your-profession-or-trade) Ontario construction contractors and workers wanting to work in Quebec (Jobs Protection Office) (/page/working-construction-ontario-and-quebec) Workplace Safety and Insurance Board ( (https://www.wsib.ca/en/contact-us) WSIB ) (https://www.wsib.ca/en/contact-us) Contact Employment Ontario Monday to Friday 8:30 am to 5:00 pm ET Tel : 416-326-5656 (tel:+14163265656) Toll-free: 1-800-387-5656 (tel:+18003875656) TTY : 1-866-533-6339 (tel:+18665336339) Chat Live (/page/employment-ontario-live-chat) contactEO@ontario.ca (mailto:contactEO@ontario.ca) Updated: July 22, 2024 Published: June 24, 2016 (https://www.ontario.ca/page/employment-ontario) Employment Ontario (https://www.ontario.ca/page/employment-ontario) Employment Ontario can help you get the training, skills and experience you need to achieve your goals. We connect people looking for work with employers looking for workers, and have locations across the province to help with job search and employment and training opportunities. Questions or comments There are many ways to contact the Government of Ontario.
